answerText: homology[10] Several homologous genes are arranged into phylogenetic trees after genomes are sequenced. Craig Venter invented this sequencing method, in which small overlapping fragments are sequenced and aligned.
heading: Penn-ance |2012 | 11 | 19 | Science | Biology | College
subject: Science
question: Question: Common examples of structures exhibiting this phenomenon are whale fins, human arms, and bat wings. For 10 points each: [10] Name this term that identifies two genes or structures that have a common ancestor. Orthologs are two genes with this property separated by speciation, while paralogs are separated by a gene duplication event.
